productName: Spiror E100 Horizontal Stretch Wrapping Machine
seoTitle: Spiror E100 Horizontal Stretch Wrapper | 60 Loads/Hour | Pallet Stabilization
metaDescription: Automated horizontal stretch wrapper processes up to 60 loads per hour. Reduces labor, improves load stability, and minimizes film usage for consistent palletized shipments.
fullContentHtml:
The Challenge: Inefficient Manual Pallet Stabilization

Manual stretch wrapping is labor-intensive, inconsistent, and a bottleneck in high-volume shipping operations. Variability in film tension and pattern leads to unstable loads, increased risk of product damage in transit, and excessive material waste.

The Solution: Automated Horizontal Wrapping

The Spiror E100 addresses these issues with a fully automated horizontal wrapping cycle. It applies consistent, programmable film tension and overlap around palletized loads, transforming a variable manual task into a repeatable, efficient process.

Key Capabilities

  • Automated operation eliminates dedicated labor for the wrapping station.
  • Programmable film tension and overlap ensure consistent load containment and optimal film usage.
  • Integrated conveyor system allows for seamless integration into existing packaging lines.
  • Robust construction with industrial-grade components for continuous operation in plant environments.

fullContentHtml:
Manufacturing Challenge: Inconsistent Manual Wrapping and High Labor Costs

Manual stretch wrapping operations create variability in film tension and containment force, leading to unstable loads during transit. This inconsistency results in product damage, increased material waste, and requires continuous operator attention, tying up valuable labor resources on repetitive tasks.

Technical Solution: Automated Horizontal Spiral Wrapping System

The E200 employs a horizontal spiral wrapping motion with programmable film overlap and tension control. The system automates the complete wrapping cycle, from film attachment to cut-and-clamp, ensuring repeatable load containment with minimal operator intervention.

Key Capabilities

  • Automated film threading and cut/clamp system eliminates manual film handling
  • Programmable wrap patterns with adjustable overlap (50-70%) for optimal material usage
  • Variable speed turntable with soft-start/stop prevents load shifting during acceleration
  • Integrated pre-stretch system maintains consistent film tension (Â±5%) throughout cycle
  • Photoelectric sensors detect load height for automatic wrap count adjustment
  • Modular design allows integration with existing conveyor systems
